properties.areaDesc: St. Clair; Huron; Bay; Tuscola; Sanilac
properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Warning issued January 11 at 4:23AM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding expected.

* WHERE...Bay, Huron, Tuscola, Sanilac and St. Clair Counties.

* WHEN...From 7 AM today to 10 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Numerous roads closed and low lying property including
homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be
inundated near the lake. Intensified shoreline erosion will
occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds increase today and remain
strong through tonight. This onshore flow produces high waves
and rising water levels resulting in significant shoreline
flooding. Low lying areas along Saginaw Bay will be particularly
susceptible to flooding as the water level is forecast to peak
near 80 inches above chart datum at Essexville tonight. There is
also potential for flooding to extend up the Saginaw River into
Bay City.
properties.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be
closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of
unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone
property.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SUNDAY
